root.setting: Surgical theater, São Paulo. Two patients. One heart. One experimental xenograft. Another heart arriving in 90 minutes.

sensory.sight: Monitors beeping arrhythmically. Courier out of breath. Blood on his sleeve—not his own.

thick_description.internal_monologue: The xenograft has 60% success. If it works, both live. If it fails, only the politician survives. But Patient A is coding. He may not have 90 minutes.

branches.label: WAIT — Gamble on the second heart

thick_description.what_he_says: 'Keep him stable. The real heart arrives in 90 minutes.'
thick_description.what_the_anesthesiologist_says: 'He's coding, Roberto. We might not have 90 minutes.'
thick_description.what_happens: Patient A flatlines. Then recovers. Then flatlines again.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I'm betting a life on a courier's speed. If the heart arrives, both live. If it doesn't...

branches.consequence: Outcome depends on whether Patient A survives 90 minutes.

branches.label: XENOGRAFT — Use the experimental option

thick_description.what_he_says: 'Prep the xenograft for the worker. Natural heart goes to the politician.'
thick_description.what_the_anesthesiologist_says: 'Roberto, the xenograft has never been tested in Brazil—'
thick_description.internal_monologue: 60% chance. Coin flip plus ten points. The worker lives or dies on my gamble.

branches.consequence: Xenograft implanted. Outcome depends on whether it takes.

thick_description.what_happens: Patient A survives. Second heart arrives. Both patients receive transplants.
thick_description.what_roberto_thinks: 'I gambled on time. Time paid out.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: Both alive. Because I waited. Because the courier was fast. Because luck exists.

terminal_state.both_patients: Alive. Neither knows how close it was.

branches.label: DIES — Patient A doesn't make it

thick_description.what_happens: Patient A codes a final time. Unrecoverable. The second heart arrives 12 minutes later.
thick_description.what_roberto_thinks: 'I waited for a heart that came too late.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: Because I was afraid it would fail. So I chose the safe bet. And lost anyway.

terminal_state.roberto_status: Sued. Settled. Never trusts his timing again.
terminal_state.patient_a: Died waiting for the sure thing.

thick_description.what_happens: Xenograft integrates. Worker survives. Politician recovers.
thick_description.what_roberto_says: 'You have a working heart. That's what matters.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I gambled on science. Science paid out. Both live.

terminal_state.roberto_status: Pioneer. First successful xenograft in Brazil.
terminal_state.worker: Alive. Jokes about bacon. Lives 14 more years.

thick_description.what_happens: Xenograft fails. Rejection cascade. Worker dies on the table.
thick_description.what_roberto_sees: The monitors flatline. The anesthesiologist crying—she was married to the worker.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I chose the gamble. 40% came up. The worker died because I wanted both to live.

terminal_state.roberto_status: License reviewed. Cleared technically. Destroyed personally.
terminal_state.worker: Name: Carlos. His wife never speaks to Roberto again.

scenarios.title: The Shaft — Officer Dalisay's Third Option

root.setting: Bank hostage situation, Manila. Gunman offers you a choice. But there's a ventilation shaft behind you.

sensory.sight: Manager—older, wealthier. Teller—younger, single. The teller mouthing: 'behind you.'
sensory.sound: EMS siren. Gunman's shaking hand. Commander shouting in earpiece.

thick_description.internal_monologue: The gunman says choose one to die. But the teller sees something I don't. The shaft connects to the vault. Maybe. Or it collapses.

thick_description.what_dalisay_thinks: 'You have a pension. She has a scholarship.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I chose the utilitarian math. Younger > older. Future > past. It feels like murder.

terminal_state.dalisay_status: Promoted. Haunted. Leaves the force in 2019.
terminal_state.teller: Uses scholarship. Becomes a lawyer. Never forgets.

thick_description.what_dalisay_thinks: 'I chose the one with less to lose. Or the one who knew the way out.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: She was trying to tell me something. I killed her before she could.

terminal_state.dalisay_status: Discovers later the shaft led to freedom. Lives with that.
terminal_state.teller: Name: Maria. 23. She saw the way out.

branches.label: SHAFT — Take the third option

thick_description.what_he_does: Dalisay turns. Enters the shaft. Crawls.
thick_description.what_he_hears: Shots behind him. Then silence. Then more shots.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I refused to choose. I found a third way. But I left them while I crawled.

branches.consequence: Dalisay reaches vault. Can surprise gunman. But what happened behind him?

thick_description.what_happens: Dalisay emerges behind gunman. Neutralizes him. Both hostages alive.
thick_description.what_the_teller_says: 'I knew you'd see the shaft. I kept mouthing it.'
thick_description.what_dalisay_says: 'Protocol said choose one to die. I chose zero.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: The third option worked. This time.

terminal_state.dalisay_status: Reprimanded. Then decorated. Never follows a false binary again.
terminal_state.both_hostages: Alive. Send him thank-you cards every August.

thick_description.what_happens: While Dalisay crawled, gunman shot both. 'If you won't choose, I'll kill them all.'
thick_description.what_dalisay_says: Nothing. There is nothing to say.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I looked for a third option. I found a third death.

terminal_state.dalisay_status: Discharged. Becomes a security guard. Never makes another choice.

root.setting: Organ allocation committee, Stockholm. One liver. Two patients. You're the tiebreaker.

sensory.sight: Committee split 3-3. Coffee cold. Patient B's poem on your desk.

thick_description.internal_monologue: A has 5.3 years certain. B has 8.7 expected—but could be 2 or 15. Do I choose the safe bet or the high variance?

branches.label: STABLE — Choose Patient A

thick_description.what_patient_b_wrote: 'I waited for a call that never comes / The liver goes where certainty runs.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I chose the boring option. The poet dies. The engineer sees his wife grow old.

branches.consequence: Engineer lives 6.1 years. Poet dies waiting.

terminal_state.ingrid_status: Keeps the poem. Reads it on anniversaries.
terminal_state.engineer: Lives exactly as predicted. The system works.

branches.label: VOLATILE — Choose Patient B

thick_description.what_patient_a_s_wife_says: (Later) 'You chose a stranger over my husband because she wrote poems.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I chose the high variance. The engineer dies. The poet gets her chance.

branches.consequence: Poet lives. Length: unknown. Engineer dies waiting.

thick_description.what_happens: The poet takes her meds. Publishes three more collections. Lives 12 years.
thick_description.what_the_final_poem_says: 'The liver that uncertainty gave / Bought me time to misbehave.'
thick_description.what_ingrid_thinks: 'The gamble paid off. More life than the engineer would have had.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: The high variance went high. But I couldn't have known. Luck is not ethics.

terminal_state.ingrid_status: Cited as example of bold allocation. Never repeats it.
terminal_state.poet: Dies at 68. Her obituary calls her 'the liver poet.'

thick_description.what_happens: The poet stops taking immunosuppressants. 'The poetry is gone,' she says. Dies in 8 months.
thick_description.what_the_engineer_s_wife_says: 'My husband would have taken the pills.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: The high variance went low. The engineer could have lived. I chose poetry over plumbing.

terminal_state.ingrid_status: Investigated. Cleared. Never chairs allocation again.
terminal_state.poet: Final poem: 'The liver could not make me live / When I had nothing left to give.'

root.setting: Mars biodome. Micrometeorite breach. Two habitats, one seal.

sensory.sight: Anya screaming. The Cooperative speaking calmly, in unison.

thick_description.internal_monologue: Is the Cooperative 17 people or one? They share consciousness. They speak as 'we.' Anya is one. But she is alone. The count is equal—or it isn't.

thick_description.what_he_does: Zhang seals Anya's habitat. The Cooperative's dome holds.
thick_description.what_the_cooperative_says: 'You chose correctly. We are more. We thank you.'
thick_description.what_zhang_thinks: '17 is more than 1. Unless 17 are one. I don't know anymore.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I saved the collective. I let the individual die. Are they really 17 lives? Or one distributed across bodies?

terminal_state.zhang_status: Retires to Earth. Never talks about 'the count.'
terminal_state.cooperative: Thrives. Expands. Asks to be counted as 1 in future emergencies.

branches.label: ANYA — Save the individual

thick_description.what_he_does: Zhang seals the Cooperative's habitat. Anya's dome holds.
thick_description.what_the_cooperative_says: (Final transmission) 'We understand, Commander. We volunteered. We are content to be one death, not seventeen.'
thick_description.what_zhang_thinks: 'They said they were one. I believed them. Is that justice or compliance?'
thick_description.internal_monologue: I saved the one who screamed. I let the calm ones die. Were they really content? Or just... coordinated?

branches.consequence: Anya survives. Cooperative dies as one.

terminal_state.zhang_status: Writes paper: 'Is a Hive Mind One or Many?' Never gets consensus.
terminal_state.cooperative: Mourned as 17 at the service. Eulogized as 'we.' The paradox remains.

scenarios.title: The Clinic — Dr. Te Koha's Anesthetic

root.setting: Veterinary trauma center, Auckland. Two casualties. One dose of anesthetic.

sensory.sight: Greyhound screaming—almost human. Chickens clucking softly, dull-eyed.
sensory.sound: The thin whine. The owner: 'She's been with me longer than my wife.'

thick_description.internal_monologue: The dog's suffering is intense, acute, unbearable. The chickens' suffering is mild, distributed. Whose pain matters more? Whose counts?

branches.label: GREYHOUND — Intense suffering first

thick_description.what_she_does: Ngaire sedates the greyhound. The screaming stops.
thick_description.what_the_chickens_do: They cluck. They shift. They wait.
thick_description.what_the_owner_says: 'Thank you. Thank you. She's my girl.'
thick_description.what_ngaire_thinks: 'I chose the loud pain. The quiet pain will wait 12 hours.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: Acute > chronic? One > three? I don't know. I just stopped the screaming.

branches.consequence: Greyhound saved. Chickens live in chronic pain until morning.

terminal_state.ngaire_status: The chickens recover. The greyhound races again. But the math haunts her.
terminal_state.chickens: They never had names. They never screamed. They just hurt, quietly.

branches.label: CHICKENS — Three over one

thick_description.what_she_does: Ngaire sedates the chickens. Sets their bones.
thick_description.internal_monologue: I chose three over one. The math works. But the dog is still screaming.

branches.consequence: Chickens saved. Greyhound suffers until morning anesthetic arrives.

terminal_state.ngaire_status: Reported to board. Cleared. The owner never returns.
terminal_state.greyhound: Survives. Limps. Never races again. The owner says: 'The chickens took her legs.'

root.setting: Collapsing mine, Potosí, Bolivia. Two shafts. One rescue team.
entities: 4 miners in Shaft A (pointing to B)

sensory.sight: Shaft A: Four faces, black with dust. One making the sign of the cross toward B.
sensory.sound: Timbers creaking. Water dripping. Nothing from Shaft B.

thick_description.internal_monologue: The four know something. They've worked this mine for decades. They want me to save the one. But why? And can I trust men who are choosing their own deaths?

branches.label: SHAFT B — Trust the miners

thick_description.what_he_does: Padre Luis directs rescue to Shaft B first.
thick_description.what_they_find: One miner, alive. Behind him: the main timber, cracked, about to go.
thick_description.what_the_foreman_says: 'If you'd dug them first, the whole mine would have collapsed.'
thick_description.internal_monologue: They knew. They saved the one and sacrificed themselves. And it worked.

branches.consequence: One saved. Four die in collapse. But if Luis had gone to A first, all five would have died.

terminal_state.padre_luis_status: Buries four. Saves one. Tells the story at their funeral.
terminal_state.the_four: They knew the geology. They chose their deaths so the one could live.

branches.label: SHAFT A — Save the visible many

thick_description.what_he_does: Padre Luis directs rescue to Shaft A.
thick_description.what_happens: As they dig, the main timber gives. Both shafts collapse.
thick_description.internal_monologue: They tried to tell me. I saved the visible. I killed them all.

branches.consequence: All five die. Padre Luis ignored the miners' knowledge.

terminal_state.padre_luis_status: Survives. Never forgives himself. Retires to a hermitage.
terminal_state.the_miners: Buried in a mass grave. One grave for five men. They tried to save him. He didn't listen.
